channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tesla's Car Business Isn't Really in the Driver's Seat
item.description: The majority of EV maker’s market cap rides on hope for robotaxis, robots and AI, but the stock is now at a sharp premium even compared with other tec...

item.title: Stock Futures Tick Higher While U.S. Steel Stock Drops
item.description: Stock futures edged higher, led by a rebound in Tesla and chip stocks, while overseas markets were mixed.

item.title: Tesla shares slide after it reports first drop in annual deliveries
item.description: Tesla's fourth-quarter deliveries report follows a huge late-year rally in the stock that lifted its gain for 2024 to 63%.

item.title: Dollar Falls Are Likely to Be Short-Lived
item.description: The dollar edged down against a basket of currencies in early trade and ING said it could continue to fall modestly once liquidity is fully re-establi...

item.title: The Stock Market Is Like a Fashion Show, and Here's One of Its Hot Must-Haves
item.description: Software companies are touting something called the “Rule of 40,” but some are more flash than substance.

item.title: Micron shares plunge on weak second-quarter guidance
item.description: Micron shares plunged in extended trading after the chipmaker issued weaker-than-expected second-quarter guidance.

item.title: AI chipmaker Broadcom shares soar 17% despite mixed quarterly results — here's why
item.description: We're increasing our price target on the stock after a slew of positive AI updates.

item.title: Darden Restaurants stock climbs as Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse fuel sales growth
item.description: Darden Restaurants met Wall Street's expectations for its fiscal second-quarter results.

item.title: Nike CEO Elliott Hill outlines new strategy after retailer blames promotions for declining revenue and profit
item.description: Nike beat Wall Street's expectations on the top and bottom lines under new CEO Elliott Hill.

item.title: European Natural Gas Prices Slip, But Stay Elevated Due to Cold Weather Forecasts
item.description: European natural gas prices fell in volatile trading amid colder-than-average weather forecasts for the next two weeks.
